result.execSummary:
The defendant Kadjah S Newson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to reimburse $35 in drug buy money and the $50 drug testing fee

Radaj, 2015 WI 50, 363 Wis.2d 633, and 973.13, Stats., the JOC is amended to remove the DNA surcharge(s).  Government entities shall, to the extent legally obligated to do so, comply with the courts Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction Re: DNA Surcharge(s) entered herein.**

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing, to occur at least one time per month
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with Amber Mayer
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment and educational purposes as approved by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
 requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.

The Court grants the Defense request that upon successful completion of Probation this record shall be expunged.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kadjah S Newson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction re: DNA Surcharge(s)

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:03am. 
Defendant Kadjah S Newson in court with Attorney Jennifer L Weber.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Unclassified Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Statute 961.41(3g)(e).

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated;  the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2.

On Count # 1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Newson on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing, to occur at least one time per month
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with Amber Mayer
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment and educational purposes as approved by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--to reimburse $35 in drug buy money and the $50 drug testing fee
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties are given.

The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.

The Court grants the Defense request that upon successful completion of Probation this record shall be expunged. The Court clarifies that Ms. Newson will need to file a petition for expungement at the conclusion of her Probation term.
recess 9:19am.
Status conference on June 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 21, 2014 at 01:20 pm.

case called at 8:37am. 
Defendant Kadjah S Newson in court with Attorney Jennifer L Weber.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Newson waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Ms. Newson verifies that the Washington Street address remains current.  
recess 8:41am.

case called at 1:06pm. 
Defendant Kadjah S Newson in court with Attorney Jennifer L. Weber.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no direct or indirect contact with Amber Mayer
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
